name: tailscale
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing xyz cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`tailscale` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/davidsbond/terraform-provider-tailscale).

id.description: The unique identifier of the device

user.description: The user associated with the device

provider.description:
The provider type for the tailscale package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

tailscale:index/acl:Acl.description:
The acl resource allows you to configure a Tailscale ACL. See the [Tailscale ACL documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1018/acls)
for more information. You can set the ACL in multiple ways including hujson.

acl.description:
The JSON-based policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network.
This can be JSON or HuJSON. Comments will not be provided when sent to the Tailscale API, they were only appear in your
local ACL file.

The JSON-based policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network.
This can be JSON or HuJSON. Comments will not be provided when sent to the Tailscale API, they were only appear in your
local ACL file.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Acl resources.

acl.description:
The JSON-based policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network.
This can be JSON or HuJSON. Comments will not be provided when sent to the Tailscale API, they were only appear in your
local ACL file.

tailscale:index/deviceAuthorization:Devi.description:
The device_authorization resource is used to approve new devices before they can join the tailnet.
See the [Tailscale device authorization documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1099/device-authorization) for more
information.

The Tailscale API currently only supports authorizing devices, but not rejecting/removing them. Once a device is
authorized by this provider it cannot be modified again afterwards. Modifying or deleting the resource
will not affect the device's authorization within the tailnet.

authorized.description: Indicates if the device is allowed to join the tailnet.
Indicates if the device is allowed to join the tailnet.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DeviceAuthorization resources.

authorized.description: Indicates if the device is allowed to join the tailnet.

tailscale:index/deviceSubnetRoutes:Devic.description:
The device_subnet_routes resource allows you to configure subnet routes for your Tailscale devices. See the
[Tailscale subnets documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1019/subnets) for more information.

deviceId.description: The device to change enabled subroutes for.

routes.description:
The subnet routes that are enabled to be routed by a device. Routes can be enabled without a 
device advertising them (e.g. for preauth).

deviceId.description: The device to change enabled subroutes for.

routes.description:
The subnet routes that are enabled to be routed by a device. Routes can be enabled without a 
device advertising them (e.g. for preauth).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DeviceSubnetRoutes resources.

deviceId.description: The device to change enabled subroutes for.

routes.description:
The subnet routes that are enabled to be routed by a device. Routes can be enabled without a 
device advertising them (e.g. for preauth).

nameservers.description:
Devices on your network will use these nameservers to resolve DNS names. IPv4 or IPv6 
addresses are accepted.

Devices on your network will use these nameservers to resolve DNS names. IPv4 or IPv6 
addresses are accepted.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DnsNameservers resources.

nameservers.description:
Devices on your network will use these nameservers to resolve DNS names. IPv4 or IPv6 
addresses are accepted.

magicDns.description:
Enables or disables MagicDNS, automatically registers DNS names for devices on your network.
At least one DNS server must be set before enabling Magic DNS.

Enables or disables MagicDNS, automatically registers DNS names for devices on your network.
At least one DNS server must be set before enabling Magic DNS.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DnsPreferences resources.

magicDns.description:
Enables or disables MagicDNS, automatically registers DNS names for devices on your network.
At least one DNS server must be set before enabling Magic DNS.

searchPaths.description: Devices on your network will use these domain suffixes to resolve DNS names.
Devices on your network will use these domain suffixes to resolve DNS names.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DnsSearchPaths resources.

searchPaths.description: Devices on your network will use these domain suffixes to resolve DNS names.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDevice.

name.description: The name of the tailnet device to obtain the attributes of.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDevice.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

user.description: The user associated with the device

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDevices.

namePrefix.description: Filters the returned list of devices to those whose name have this prefix.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDevices.

devices.description: The list of devices returned from the Tailscale API. Each element contains the following:
